item.title: Zuckerberg's Meta Faces $1.3 Billion EU Fine for Data Processing
item.description: Meta, formerly known as Facebook, has been fined â‚¬1.2 billion ($1.3 billion) by the European Union for violating data protection laws. The fine is the largest ever imposed by the EU for data protection violations. Meta was found to have failed to adequately protect the personal data of its European users.
